item.title: Public Access and Lands Improvement Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.title: Sacramento-San Joaquin Valley Emergency Water Delivery Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 306.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 190 (Roll no. 37). (text: CR H1602-1603)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 190 (Roll no. 37).(text: CR H1602-1603)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 196 (Roll no. 36). (consideration: CR H1606-1609)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 472.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1602-1611)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 83.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2954 and H.R. 3964. The resolution provides one hour of general debate for each bill. In each instance, the resolution makes in order only those amendments printed in the Rules Committee Report 113-340. The resolution provides one motion to recommit with or without instructions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-340, by Mr. Bishop (UT).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-340, by Mr. Bishop (UT).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2954) to authorize Escambia County, Florida, to convey certain property that was formerly part of Santa Rosa Island National Monument and that was conveyed to Escambia County subject to restrictions on use and reconveyance, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3964) to address certain water-related concerns in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Valley.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2954) to authorize Escambia County, Florida, to convey certain property that was formerly part of Santa Rosa Island National Monument and that was conveyed to Escambia County subject to restrictions on use and reconveyance, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3964) to address certain water-related concerns in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Valley, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
